page.title: 02 ATTLEBOROUGH (Continued)
page.content: The town expanded with the coming of the railway in 1845.The gasworks were built in 1860 and the Corn Hall in 1863.The large houses on Station Road and Connaught Road were built about this time by wealthier and professional citizens.The coaching trade suffered as a result of the railways development. The railway still operates(pay trains) but has gone into decline.The car is now the main form of transport in the area.Most residents work outside the area but there has been a considerable building programme and population increase over the past 20 years. Through traffic has been one of the main drawbacks in recent years but the opening of the bypass (Jun '85) should herald the start of a more peaceful and enjoyable existence for those living and shopping in the town.
